revised_title: The Role of Floating Matter in the Air in the Development of Bacterial Life and Putrefaction
tldr: The author conducted experiments to study the relationship between the floating matter in the air and the development of bacterial life and putrefaction. They found that the presence of floating matter in the air is necessary for the growth of bacteria and putrefaction, while the absence of floating matter prevents it. This discovery supports the idea that the power of developing life in the air and its power of scattering light are closely related.
